Clip.Title: OPERATION MINCEMEAT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Based on the best-selling book, Operation Mincemeat reveals the most successful deception of World War II that has been shrouded in secrecy for more than sixty years.

Clip.Title: MISSION TO MURDER HITLER
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The operation Valkyrie to kill Hitler was led by German resistance willing to turn traitor to save lives. See how the plot was nearly carried out, through gripping re-enactments, and firsthand interviews from members of the resistance.

Clip.Title: THE KGB DISSIDENT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This documentary tells the story of KGB officer Viktor Orekhov who monitored, collected evidence and severely punished the dissidents of the USSR.

Clip.Title: OPERATION MINCEMEAT

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From scenic Telegraph Cove, around Cape Scott Provincial Park and beyond - Vancouver Island's Northern Coastline is one of the world's last, great wilderness frontiers.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the remote Northern Shore of Nova Scotia, to the red mud perimetre of Prince Edward Island, the warm waters of the Northumberland Strait are the setting for an incredible aerial exploration of these coastlines.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: SERIOUSLY AMAZING OBJECTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: America is truly a melting pot, one that's been simmering for centuries, and made up of warriors, innovators, icons, and the objects they left behind. Follow one lucky couple as they're whisked to Montana to witness a re-creation of the Battle of Little Bighorn. Then watch as a friends' trip to the zoo turns into an art project with pandas. Private tours of the secret vaults to see Edison's first bulbs, the first Colt revolver, and other incredible artifacts make for a Smithsonian visit they'll never forget.

Clip.Title: ELIZABETH I: KILLER QUEEN
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Did one of the most controversial royal love affairs in history lead to savage murder? New evidence sheds light on the Elizabethan murder mystery that has lain unsolved for 450 years.

Clip.Title: THE KGB DISSIDENT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This documentary tells the story of KGB officer Viktor Orekhov who monitored, collected evidence and severely punished the dissidents of the USSR.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the creation legends of Naikoon Provincial Park, to rich sea lion colonies, and remote lighthouses - Haida Gwaii's northern coastlines record an epic journey.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: SPACE VOYAGES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Space is no longer just for governments. Little companies with big ideas are now reaching for the skies, making commercial human spaceflight a reality. Private businesses are investing big and aiming high, building their own rockets and orbiters, deploying commercial satellites to connect the globe, and preparing for space tourism. NASA's shuttle may have been grounded, but for corporations, the sky is no longer the limit.
